description.narrative:
Nordmakedoniens statliga statistikkontor (vidare SSO) ansvarar för officiell statistik, för samordning av det statistiska systemet och internationellt samarbete inom statistikområdet. SSO är ett viktigt stöd genom den officiella statistik de tillhandahåller och som kopplas till EU-förhandlingar.
Projektet ”Ökad tillgänglighet och användning av officiell statistik i Nordmakedonien” har utarbetats gemensamt av SSO och SCB, med det övergripande projektmålet att öka användarnas förtroende för Nordmakedonien, med hjälp av ökad tillgänglighet och användning av officiell statistik i landet.
För att bidra till att det övergripande målet uppnås kommer projektet att arbeta för att: förbättra effektiviteten i framställningen av statistik; öka utbudet och förbättra kvaliteten på framställningen av statistisk; förbättra kommunikationen och stärka samordningen av det Nationella Statistiksystemet (NSS) och förbättra effektiviteten när det gäller personalhantering inom organisationen.
Användarnas ökade förtroende för statikuppgifternas korrekthet och tillförlitlighet förväntas göra det möjligt för statliga institutioner att förbereda sin socialpolitik; för forskare och icke-statliga organisationer att använda uppgifterna för att argumentera för de fattigas rättigheter. Samtidigt kommer SSO att uppfylla befintliga EU-krav (2019 års meddelande om EU:s utvidgningspolitik, Nordmakedonienrapporten - kapitel 18, och Riktlinjer för europeisk statistik) och Agenda 2030 (SDG 5; SDG 16 och SDG 17).
Den begärda projektbudgeten är 14 000 000 SEK för perioden september 2019 - december 2021.

The State Statistical office of North Macedonia (further SSO) has the responsibility to produce official statistics in the country, to coordinate the National Statistical System and international cooperation in the field of statistics. SSO has also an important support role to provide official statistics related to the EU negotiations.
The project “Increased availability and use of official statistics in North Macedonia” is jointly prepared by SSO and SCB, with an overall project goal to increase user confidence in North Macedonia, by the means of increased availability and use of official statistics in the country.
To contribute to the achievement of the overall goal, the project will work towards improved efficiency of the statistical production; increased range and improved quality of statistical production; improved communications and strengthened coordination of the National Statistical System (NSS), and improved efficiency of human resource management within the organization.
Users increased confidence in the accuracy and reliability of provided statistical data will enable the state institutions to prepare their social policies, and the researchers and NGO's to utilize the data to argue for the rights of the poor. At the same time, SSO will comply to the existing EU requirements (2019 Communication on EU Enlargement Policy, North Macedonia 2019 Report - Chapter 18, and the European Statistics Code of Practice), and the Agenda 2030 (SDG 5; SDG 16 and SDG 17).
The requested project budget is SEK 14 000 000, for the period September 2019 - December 2021.

The project Increased availability and use of official statistics in North Macedonia, is about partnership cooperation between the Statistics Sweden and the State Statistical Office of North Macedonia. The overall project goal is to reach increased user confidence in North Macedonia, by the means of increased availability and use of official statistics in the country. To contribute to the achievement of the overall goal, the project will work towards the following outcomes: - improved efficiency of the statistical production process;- increased range and improved quality of statistical production;- improved communications and strenghtened coordination of the National Statistical System (NSS);- improved efficiency of human resource management. The theory of change of the proposed intervention is as follows - IF the availability and use of official statistics in the country increases: (1) by increasing and further developing of the institutional capacity and knowledge at SSO and thereby by improving the efficiency of statistical production process; (2) as well as by increasing the range and improving the quality of statistical production; (3) by improving the communication of statistical data in the public and by strenghtening the coordination of the NSS; AND, IF SSO (4) improves efficiency of its human resource management; THEN SSO will contribute to increased users confidence in the accuracy and reliability of provided statistical data. This will enable the institutions to prepare their social policies, and the reserchers and NGO's to utilize the data, and to argue for the rights of the poor. At the same time, SSO will comply to the existing EU requirements (2019 Communication on EU Enlargement Policy , North Macedonia 2019 Report - Chapter 18 and European Statistics Code of Practice) and the Agenda 2030 (SDG 5; SDG 16 and SDG 17). The project budget is 14,000,000.00 SEK for the period September 2019 - August 2022.

tag.narrative: 16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

17.9 - Enhance international support for implementing effective and targeted capacity-building in developing countries to support national plans to implement all the Sustainable Development Goals, including through North-South, South-South and triangular cooperation.

17.9 - Öka det internationella stödet för genomförande av effektiv och riktad kapacitetsuppbyggnad i utvecklingsländerna till stöd för nationella planer för att genomföra alla målen för hållbar utveckling, inklusive genom samarbete nord–syd och syd–syd samt trepartssamarbete.
5.b - Enhance the use of enabling technology, in particular information and communications technology, to promote the empowerment of women.
5.b - Öka användningen av gynnsam teknik, i synnerhet informations- och kommunikationsteknik, för att främja kvinnors egenmakt

title.narrative: Överenskommelse om bidrag mellan Sida och SCB gällande Ökad tillgänglighet och användning av officiell statistik i Nordmakedonien - partnerskapssamarbete mellan svenska Statistiska Centralbyrån (SCB) och Nordmakedoniens Statliga Statistikbyrå (SSO)

Beslut om insats gällande Ökad tillgänglighet och användning av officiell statistik i Nordmakedonien - partnerskapssamarbete mellan svenska Statistiska Centralbyrån (SCB) och Nordmakedoniens Statliga Statistikbyrå (SSO)

description.narrative:
From CoP in May 2021: Below is a summary of results that the partner have reached, focusing on the period December 2019 - December 2020. The period was strongly characterized by the outbreak of covid-19, which started just when project activities were about to begin. The pandemic and the restrictions and consequences that followed led to delays in the implementation of the project, which thus resulted in fewer achievements than was originally planned. For instance, activities were postponed, the Long-Term Advisor (LTA) was not posted and short-term experts from Sweden were not sent on missions to Skopje. More recently, SSO’s intense preparations for the Census of Population, Households and Dwellings has had an impact on the progress of the project. Since November 2020, SSO has intensified its work with the Census and as a result, between January and April 2021, this has taken up so much of the staff's time that they had to force all project activities to pause. During 2020, all meetings and workshops were digital and the focus in all components (except Component 1) was to first define the support needed from Statistics Sweden to reach the component outcome and then to plan accordingly. Also, while covid-19 posed a big challenge to the project, some progress was still being made. Below is a summary of progress within each component objective. Component objective 1: Improved statistical production process efficiencyIn order to improve the statistical production process efficiency, including improvement of a planning and monitoring framework, a project management board was created during the mission to Skopje in September 2020. Since then, the board (incl. the LTA, the project coordinator and vice project coordinator, and the four project component heads) has met digitally every second week with an agenda based on the MEL (Monotoring, Evaluation and Learning) approach. During the same mission, it was decided that the arrangement of activities within this component objective needed to be modified as similar activities are sequentially executed within the ongoing Instrument for Pre-Accession Assistance (IPA) programme at SSO. In order to avoid future overlapping, activities related to output 1.1, 1.2 and 1.3 will not take place until a new needs assessment has been conducted in the autumn of 2021. Component objective 2: Improved range and quality of statistical productionIn November and December 2020, Statistics Sweden completed an online ICT fact-finding mission, which revealed that SSO's staff has advanced technical skills, but the number of staff is low. For the Employment register (output 2.1), Statistics Sweden and SSO jointly made an assessment of the current situation and defined the way forward. With regards to the Services Producer Price Index (SPPI, output 2.2), after a preliminary mapping was conducted, a questionnaire was finalised and the initial collection of data started. For the training in statistical methodology (output 2.3), trainers have been identified and the partner have agreed to start developing training material based on a course held for new employees at Statistics Sweden, but adapted to the North Macedonian context. Component objective 3: Improved communications and NSS coordinationTo achieve improved communication, the first step of the project is to develop SSO’s external and internal communication strategy (Output 3.4), including a social media strategy (Output 3.2). In 2020, Statistics Sweden made an initial assessment of SSO’s context and needs. Also, two workshops were held focusing on communicating with the media and communicating via social media. The re-design of SSO's website (output 3.1) will not take place until the communication strategy has been set. The NSS coordination work has only begun and after online meetings in the last quarter of 2020, the partner have identified three areas for future work. Specific activities have been defined in two areas, but a plan for how and when activities will be performed is yet to be developed. However, the content in this component may be revised focusing only on internal and external communicatio, pending request from Statistics Sweden and approval of Sida. Component objective 4: Improved efficiency of human resource managementDuring 2020, the focus at Statistics Sweden has been to start developing management training material (output 4.4) for head of departments and head of sectors at SSO, which can be conducted on site as soon as the situation allows. The staff survey (output 4.1) will be developed and implemented after the training has taken place and the intranet (output 4.2) will be developed when the internal communication strategy has been set (output 3.4). Discussion around regional missions (output 4.3) has been discussed but no MoU has yet been signed.
In addition to the reported progress within each component, a few other achievements were made: - Agreement between the EU delegation in Skopje and Statistics Sweden to participate as observers at each other’s project steering group meetings.- Investment in new IT equipment to improve remote support.- Statistics Sweden and SSO together underwent digital training in Results Based Management (RBM). With regards to the last point above, the partner have reported that working with RBM as a project management group, as well as having regular project management meetings, have had a positive effect on SSO's ownership and motivation during 2020. Working actively together has made it possible to work in a flexible way, focusing on learning, re-assessing and adaptation. In addition, it has also reduced the risk related to lack of staff at SSO dedicated to the project as well as a lack of engagement or a resistance to change by the same. During the annual meeting in May 2021, they confirmed that SSO has strongly improved their capacity and knowledge of RBM and will together with Statistics Sweden update the RBM-matrix based on these learnings. Nevertheless, although some results have been shown it is worth mentioning that the project is still delayed. Based on estimations from SCB, the project will most likely not be up and running in a normal pace until 2022. As a result, a no-cost extension of ten months will be requested. If the extension is approved, the activity period will be extended until 30 June 2023. A formal request incl. a budget will be sent to Sida via email.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
